snippet: Not only must Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain respond to the beheading of a British hostage by Islamic radicals, but he also faces the risk of becoming the leader who presided over the breakup of the United Kingdom.
abstract: Opinion polls on Scottish independence vote and threats to British hostages by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria have put considerable pressure on British Prime Min David Cameron; issues have raised questions about fate of Cameron's government and left him scrambling to address two divergent challenges simultaneously.

byline.contributor: Jenny Anderson and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Not only must Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain respond to the beheading of a British hostage by Islamic radicals, but he also faces the risk of becoming the leader who presided over the breakup of the United Kingdom.

headline.main: Cameron Under Pressure as Scotland Vote Nears
headline.print_headline: Cameron Under Pressure as Scotland Vote Nears

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
